notes.note: Firefox Home (the default New Tab) now allows users to display up to 4 rows of top sites, Pocket stories, and highlights.

“Reopen in Container” tab menu option appears for users with Containers that lets them choose to reopen a tab in a different container. ([Bug 1376119][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1376119

In advance of removing all trust for Symantec-issued certificates in Firefox 63, a preference was added that allows users to distrust certificates issued by Symantec. To use this preference, go to about:config in the address bar and set the preference "security.pki.distrust_ca_policy" to 2 ([Bug 1456112][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1456112

Improved graphics rendering for Windows users without accelerated hardware using Parallel-Off-Main-Thread Painting ([Bug 1454980][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1454980

Support for CSS Shapes, allowing for richer web page layouts ([Bug 1098939][1]). This goes hand in hand with a brand new Shape Path Editor in the CSS inspector ([Bug 1242029][2]).


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1098939
  [2]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1242029

CSS Variable Fonts (OpenType Font Variations) support, which makes it possible to create beautiful typography with a single font file ([Bug 1302685][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1302685

Updates for [enterprise environments][1]:

 - AutoConfig is sandboxed to the [documented API][2] by default. You
   can disable the sandbox by setting the preference
   general.config.sandbox_enabled to false. Our long term plan is to
   remove the ability to turn off the sandboxing. If you need to
   continue to use more complex AutoConfig scripts, you will need to use
   [Firefox Extended Support Release (ESR)][3].

  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/products/firefox-enterprise
  [2]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/customizing-firefox-using-autoconfig
  [3]: https://www.mozilla.org/firefox/organizations/

Removed the description field for bookmarks. Users who have stored descriptions using the field may wish to export these descriptions as [html][1] or [json][2] files, as they will be removed in a future release.


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/export-firefox-bookmarks-to-backup-or-transfer
  [2]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/restore-bookmarks-from-backup-or-move-them#w_backup-and-restore

Dark theme is automatically enabled in macOS 10.14 dark mode ([Bug 1466335][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1466335

Changed the default setting to Enforce (3) for the security.pki.name_matching_mode preference ([Bug 1463936][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1463936

[Adobe Flash][1] applets now run in a more secure mode using process sandboxing on macOS. Learn how this may affect features [here][2].


  [1]: https://www.adobe.com/products/flashplayer.html
  [2]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/changes-affecting-adobe-flash-firefox-mac
Users disconnecting from Sync are now offered the option to wipe their Firefox profile data (including bookmarks, passwords, history, cookies, and site data) from their desktop computer

Changed how WebRTC handles screen sharing: When screen-sharing a window, the window will be brought to front. ([Bug 1450658][1])


  [1]: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1450658
Three-pane Inspector in Developer Tools separates the rules into its own panel

## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10

### Recommended Hardware
-  Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
-  512MB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- macOS 10.9
- macOS 10.10
- macOS 10.11
- macOS 10.12
- macOS 10.13

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 3.4 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.22 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.6.1 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
    - PulseAudio
